intro: Psacalium obtusilobum, commonly known as the broad-lobed psacalium, is a flowering plant species native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves with rounded lobes and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in wetland or riparian habitats, preferring moist, well-drained soils. Psacalium obtusilobum is often used in ornamental gardening due to its striking appearance and adaptability to various climates.
